video.title: TypeScript 101 (tutorial)
video.description:
Introduction to TypeScript. TypeScript is an open-source programming language developed and maintained by Microsoft. It is a strict syntactical superset of JavaScript, and adds optional static typing to the language.

Check out Dylan Israel's YouTube channel: https://www.youtube.com/channel/UC5Wi_NYysX-LfcqT3Hq9Faw

--

Learn to code for free and get a developer job: https://www.freecodecamp.com

Read hundreds of articles on programming: https://medium.freecodecamp.com

topLevelComment.author: Zoli K
topLevelComment.text:
What you said about types is incorrect. Please update the video to avoid misleading people.
They don't need to be declared in the same file and can be imported/exported just like interfaces.
Also, they are not getting deprecated.

topLevelComment.author: kuki
topLevelComment.text: i was kind a skeptical about 'ts101' title at first, but Dylan you did a really good job. Thank you!

topLevelComment.author: Pallavi Manan
topLevelComment.text: Hi there! Is knowing Javascript a pre-requisite for learning Typescript? TIA

replies.author: G K
replies.text: @Thokchom Prabinkumar DqEYCkSJNH no, of course technically you could start with any language. Just that the syntax is so similar and in the end it does compile to JS anyway. The point of TS is really that it improves JS and fixes a lot of its issues and makes debugging easier. So it makes sense to be familiar with basic JS concepts before going to TS

replies.author: G K
replies.text: @Thokchom Prabinkumar DqEYCkSJNH actually it kind of is yes

topLevelComment.author: Diksha Joshi
topLevelComment.text: when are you introducing typescript in fcc website

topLevelComment.author: Ahmed T.
topLevelComment.text: 11:35 JavaScript is dynamically typed, not static.

replies.author: TheSavageSalmon
replies.text: @Priyanshu Nayan no, its dynamically typed, hence the typeof operator

topLevelComment.author: JoelRemix
topLevelComment.text: Thank you for sharing. Thanks again 👍. I see that you did eventually made text bigger!! Awesome stuff
